Package guitests

Class GuiRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.testfx.api.FxRobot
      • guitests.GuiRobot

  • public class GuiRobot
extends org.testfx.api.FxRobot
    Robot used to simulate user actions on the GUI. Extends FxRobot by adding some customized functionality and workarounds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiRobot

        public GuiRobot​()

    • Method Detail

      • pauseForHuman

        public void pauseForHuman​()
        Pauses execution for PAUSE_FOR_HUMAN_DELAY_MILLISECONDS milliseconds for a human to examine the effects of the test. This method will be disabled when the GUI tests are executed in headless mode to avoid unnecessary delays.

      • isHeadlessMode

        public boolean isHeadlessMode​()
        Returns true if tests are run in headless mode.

      • waitForEvent

        public void waitForEvent​(java.util.function.BooleanSupplier event)
        Waits for event to be true by DEFAULT_WAIT_FOR_EVENT_TIMEOUT_MILLISECONDS milliseconds.
        Throws:
        guitests.GuiRobot.EventTimeoutException - if the time taken exceeds DEFAULT_WAIT_FOR_EVENT_TIMEOUT_MILLISECONDS milliseconds.

      • waitForEvent

        public void waitForEvent​(java.util.function.BooleanSupplier event,
                         int timeOut)
        Waits for event to be true.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - in milliseconds
        Throws:
        guitests.GuiRobot.EventTimeoutException - if the time taken exceeds timeOut.

      • isWindowShown

        public boolean isWindowShown​(java.lang.String stageTitle)
        Returns true if the window with stageTitle is currently open.

      • getNumberOfWindowsShown

        public int getNumberOfWindowsShown​(java.lang.String stageTitle)
        Returns the number of windows with stageTitle that are currently open.

      • getStage

        public javafx.stage.Stage getStage​(java.lang.String stageTitle)
        Returns the first stage, ordered by proximity to the current target window, with the stage title. The order that the windows are searched are as follows (proximity): current target window, children of the target window, rest of the windows.
        Throws:
        StageNotFoundException - if the stage is not found.
